title: Athletes are left to bring light to troubled Tokyo Olympics
Mississippi asks US Supreme Court to overturn Roe v. Wade
description: Mississippi's attorney general told the Supreme Court on Thursday that Roe v. Wade was "egregiously wrong" and should be overturned as she urged the justices to allow a controversial law that bars most abortions after 15 weeks to go into effect.

title: Biden officials shift to an urgent tone as Covid-19 fight enters troubling new phase
description: Biden administration officials acknowledged Thursday the pandemic that appeared to be waning a month ago has entered a new, troubling phase.

title: Typhoon lashes Japan's southern islands as another tropical threat looms
description: Typhoon In-fa is bearing down on the southern Japanese islands and has its eye set on eastern China by next week. The storm could bring extremely heavy rainfall totals to millions in China and Taiwan.

title: Pelosi looks to bolster bipartisan standing of riot investigation committee
description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is considering naming GOP Rep. Adam Kinzinger to join the select committee investigating the deadly January 6 insurrection at the US Capitol.

title: NFL says coronavirus outbreaks among unvaccinated players may lead to forfeits this season
description: If a National Football League game cannot be rescheduled and is canceled due to a Covid-19 outbreak among unvaccinated players, that team will have to forfeit and will be credited with a loss, the NFL said in a league-wide memo obtained by CNN.

title: As the West winds down its 'war on terror,' jihadists are filling the vacuum, UN warns
description: As the 20th anniversary of 9/11 approaches, the United Nations is warning that the threat from terror groups such as ISIS and al Qaeda is not only resilient, but in many places expanding.

title: For 'Ted Lasso' actor Cristo Fernández, football was life until life had other plans
description: Not unlike his "Ted Lasso" character Dani Rojas, for 15-year old Cristo Fernández, football -- known stateside as soccer -- really was life.

title: Iranian ships that appeared headed for Venezuela are now in Baltic Sea approaching Russia
description: Two Iranian ships that once appeared to be headed to Venezuela are now in the Baltic Sea approaching the Russian city of St. Petersburg, according to MarineTraffic, a website that tracks ships.

title: Australia's cockatoos taught each other to open trash cans for food, study finds
description: A few years ago, Australian scientist Richard Major took a video of a cockatoo in Sydney opening a closed trash bin lid with its beak and foot to access the gold mine of leftover food inside.

title: Fact check: Biden makes false claims about Covid-19, auto prices
description: President Joe Biden participated Wednesday in the second CNN town hall of his presidency, taking questions from anchor Don Lemon and local residents in Cincinnati.

title: Not all Republicans are embracing McConnell's vaccine push. Read what some had to say
description: Nearly half of House Republicans still won't say publicly​ whether they are vaccinated against Covid-19, even as new cases rise nationwide.

title: Hospitalized Covid-19 patients are asking for the vaccine -- when it's too late
description: As the Delta variant helps fuel a surge in Covid-19 hospitalizations in the US, unvaccinated patients are regretting their inoculation status, two health care workers say.

title: Massive internet outage: FedEx, Delta and McDonald's go down
description: A sweeping internet disruption on Thursday briefly took out a wide range of major corporate websites — from FedEx and Delta Airlines to HSBC and McDonald's.

title: How Covid-19 is ripping through one team at Tokyo 2020
description: Czech beach volleyball players Markéta Sluková-Nausch and Barbora Hermannova are coming to terms with being ruled out of the 2020 Tokyo Olympic Games as the European team grapples with a growing Covid-19 problem.

title: 'Less thinking' and other tips on stress from an Olympian
description: Armand "Mondo" Duplantis holds the world record in pole vault and he's sharing his tips on managing stress in competition to help the rest of us manage stress in everyday life.

title: Iconic moments from Summer Olympics history
description: The Summer Olympics have provided us with many unforgettable moments over the years.

title: More than 150 people still missing in German floods unlikely to be found, officials fear
description: A week after severe flooding hit western Europe, devastating Germany, Belgium and the Netherlands, German officials said Thursday they fear the 158 people still missing there may not be found.

title: Lorde got so drunk with Seth Meyers she needed an IV drip
description: Lorde got her drink on with Seth Meyers in the return of the drinking game on "Late Night with Seth Meyers."

title: Intoxicated late-night host has trouble with Lorde's real name
description: Late-night host Seth Meyers challenged singer Lorde to a series of drinking games during the first airing of the popular segment "Day Drinking" since the beginning of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Ryan Reynolds gets real about anxiety
description: Canadian actor Ryan Reynolds got honest this week about his mental health and the impact that anxiety has had on his life and work.

title: Daughter of detained man behind 'Hotel Rwanda' 'spied on' by Israeli software
description: The daughter of Paul Rusesabagina, a former hotelier who inspired the movie "Hotel Rwanda," has hit out at Rwandan authorities after a report emerged that she was on a list of people targeted by Pegasus, a military-grade spyware licensed by an Israeli company to governments.

title: The Rolling Stones announce rescheduled tour dates
description: After a couple stops, The Rolling Stones' "No Filter" tour is now set to go on.

title: Chinese government rejects WHO plan for second phase of Covid-19 origins study
Megan Fox quit drinking years ago after getting belligerent at the Golden Globes
description: Megan Fox may not remember a great deal from the 2009 Golden Globe Awards, but she does know she "got in a lot of trouble" for things she said on the red carpet while tipsy.

title: Indian tax officials raid newspaper that took on Narendra Modi over the pandemic
description: Tax authorities in India raided several offices of one of the world's biggest-selling newspapers on Thursday, a move journalists and leading opposition politicians described as an attack on press freedom.

title: Death toll rises as passengers recount horror of China subway floods
description: At least 33 people have died and eight remain missing in central China, as authorities ramp up rescue and recovery efforts following devastating floods that submerged entire neighborhoods, trapped passengers in subway cars, caused landslides and overwhelmed dams and rivers.

title: TikTok, Biden administration agree to drop litigation over Trump-era app store ban
description: TikTok and the US government agreed on Wednesday to drop a lawsuit challenging the Trump administration's attempt to ban the short-form video app from US app stores.

title: Chimpanzees have been spotted attacking and killing gorillas in the wild for the first time
description: Chimpanzees' lethal attacks on gorillas in the wild have been observed for the first time, a team of researchers has said.

title: Astronomers spy first moon-forming disk around an exoplanet
description: For the first time, astronomers have found a disk around a Jupiter-like planet outside of our solar system -- the kind of disk where moons could actively be forming.

title: CNN reporter shares heartbreaking personal story about vaccine inequality
description: CNN's Larry Madowo shares his frustration and anger over losing his uncle to Covid-19 and says vaccine inequality around the world must end.

title: Anna Faris accidentally reveals she eloped
description: Anna Faris has let slip that she and her partner Michael Barrett recently eloped.

title: A 22-foot spaceman sculpture has landed in the Caribbean Sea
description: Billionaires Richard Branson and Jeff Bezos have embarked on their own space race this month, there's one spaceman that has found its home in the Caribbean Sea.

title: Analysis: Things are looking dire for Chinese tech
China rejects new Covid origin probe
description: • More than two thirds of India may have Covid antibodies, new survey shows

title: More than two thirds of India may have Covid antibodies, new survey shows
description: More than two thirds of India's population may have Covid-19 antibodies, according to a new serological survey released Tuesday, providing yet more evidence the virus may have spread far more widely than official figures suggest.

title: New audio recording from Trump interview
description: New audio recordings of an interview with former President Donald Trump for the book "I Alone Can Fix It" reveal how Trump felt about the then Vice President Mike Pence following the election.

title: How skateboarding went mainstream in Japan
description: As skateboarding makes its Olympic debut in Tokyo, Japan's home team is gunning for gold. CNN's Blake Essig speaks with the Osaka Daggers, a cutting-edge street skateboarding crew, to trace the country's skateboarding origins and explores how it's gaining in popularity as it prepares to make a splash at the Summer Games.

title: The Korean zombies storming Netflix
description: Hwang Hyo-kyun deceives people for a living. The more his audience notices his work, the worse job he's done.

title: Biden reveals what foreign leaders are asking him
description: During a CNN town hall, President Joe Biden revealed what leaders around the world are asking him after four years of the Trump presidency.

title: Biden confronts vaccine myths, defends economic plans at presidential town hall
NBA star celebrates championship win in unique way
description: Why did a basketball superstar order EXACTLY 50 chicken nuggets? CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.
